comments: Vicky is a very sweet lady. She is very helpful. If you need help with a quiz or exam if you stay after class she will help you out so there should be no reason not to pass. There are students who don\'t like to pay attention so if you are one of those don\'t take this class. She does have a different teaching style but it is very helpful! take her!

I read these comments before taking her class and was scared that she was going to be hard and a bad teacher but she is the exact opposite of what people said. As long as you respect her no voice rule and attend class you\'ll be fine. Her teaching style is diff but very helpful. Helps after class with quizzes and exams so no excuse for not passing!!

do not listen to all the comments here. vicky was a great teacher she is patient and she helps you when you need it, whether it be on the test or on your presentation. she can be strict but she is funny and friendly. you just have to obey her no voice rule. her class was very easy. just take the time to get to know her and you will have fun

outof all the asl profs she is the worst, doesnt teach but expects you to know things her way.is rude&unapproachable,she signs way 2 fast on the tests and doesnt repeat anything, out of the asl profs that i had she assigns 2x asmuch work and projects, she is over controlling and doesnt help her students, better off teaching yourself, ull have too h

She is a horrible teacher..she doesn\'t teach you how to sign ASL sentences then expects you to stand up in front of the class to sign a presentation in ASL format. She is strict, mean and unapproachable! You are lucky if you learn anything from her. She teaches you vocabulary that ASL users don\'t even use anymore. The class is a huge waste of time!

She was extremely intolerant of any use of voicing or SEE signs or even mouthing along with your signing. She invited guest speakers that shared her animosity towards anything but ASL, which is not useful towards teaching hearing people the language, nor in developing small children in the use of language.
